column4: Amazon courts Hachette authors by proposing they keep e-book revenue
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc proposed that Hachette Book Group authors keep 100 percent of revenue from e-book sales while the two sides work through a thorny contract dispute that has kept some of the publisher's books off Amazon's website for months.

column4: Amazon proposes Hachette authors keep all revenue as dispute drags on
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  July 8 Amazon.com Inc  has proposed that Hachette authors keep 100 percent of revenue from digital book sales while both sides work to resolve a contractual dispute that has kept some Hachette books off its website for months  the Wall Street Journal cited people familiar with the matter as saying.

column4: Latam e-commerce firm Linio gets $79 million in new investment
column5: BERLIN Linio  an e-commerce company bidding to be the Amazon of Latin America set up by German venture capital firm Rocket Internet  has attracted 58 million euros ($79 million) in new funding  helping it expand to new markets like Chile.

column4: REFILE-Latam e-commerce firm Linio gets $79 mln in new investment
column5: BERLIN  July 8 Linio  an e-commerce company bidding to be the Amazon of Latin America set up by German venture capital firm Rocket Internet  has attracted 58 million euros ($79 million) in new funding  helping it expand to new markets like Chile.

column4: Amazon rainforest grew after climate change 2 000 years ago: study
column5: OSLO Swathes of the Amazon may have been grassland until a natural shift to a wetter climate about 2 000 years ago let the rainforests form  according to a study that challenges common belief that the worldâ€™s biggest tropical forest is far older.

column4: Italy's Post Office president sees sale 'after November'
column5: ROME The Italian government's sale of 40 percent of the postal service Poste Italiane will take place after November  the company's president said on Tuesday in the latest indication that the listing slated for this year may be pushed back.

column4: Exelon shuts New Jersey 614-MW Oyster Creek nuclear reactor
